Compute Posterior Moments Using AGHQ

Source: R/utils.R
dot-compute_posterior_aghq.Rd

Computes posterior mean, variance, and other moments of the random effect using adaptive Gauss-Hermite quadrature via the aghq package.

Usage

.compute_posterior_aghq(
  ode_solution,
  data,
  b_hat_init,
  measurement_error_sd,
  random_effect_sd,
  k = 7
)

Arguments

ode_solution

List containing ODE solution with components:

cum_hazard

Cumulative hazard at event time without random effect

log_hazard

Log-hazard at event time without random effect

biomarker

Biomarker values at observation times without random effect

data

A list containing subject-specific data:

time

Event/censoring time

status

Event indicator (0/1)

covariates

Baseline covariates for survival model

longitudinal

List with times, measurements, covariates

b_hat_init

Initial guess for posterior mean \(E[b_i|\mathcal{O}_i]\)

measurement_error_sd

Measurement error standard deviation

random_effect_sd

Random effect standard deviation

k

Number of quadrature points (default: 7)

Value

List containing:

b_hat

Posterior mean \(E[b_i|\mathcal{O}_i]\)

v_hat

Posterior variance \(Var[b_i|\mathcal{O}_i]\)

exp_b

\(E[exp(b_i)|\mathcal{O}_i]\) for survival component
